intro: Gonolobus dutrae, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically has heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blue or purple blooms. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Gonolobus dutrae is also known for its rapid growth and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
